alert.note: Alert for Holt; Nodaway; Worth (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Worth, northeastern Holt and central Nodaway Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Skidmore, or 10 miles west of Maryville, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Maryville, Mound City, Burlington Junction, Hopkins, Maitland, Skidmore, Sheridan, Graham, Pickering, Quitman and Bigelow. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 76 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Missouri.
